sn56.61:1.1: Then the Buddha, picking up a little bit of dirt under his fingernail, addressed the mendicants:
sn56.61:1.3: Which is more: the little bit of dirt under my fingernail, or this great earth?”
sn56.61:1.4: “Sir, the great earth is certainly more. The little bit of dirt under your fingernail is tiny.
sn56.61:1.5: Compared to the great earth, it can’t be reckoned or compared, it’s not even a fraction.”
sn56.61:2.1: “In the same way, the sentient beings reborn as humans are few, while those not reborn as humans are many.
sn56.61:2.3: It’s because they haven’t seen the four noble truths.
sn56.61:2.5: The noble truths of suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.
sn56.61:3.1: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
